properties.publicTransport: Buses will run frequently between the city, Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Buses will be in high demand so allow extra travel time. Avoid the largest crowds by visiting on a weekday instead. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sculpture by the Sea exhibition returns to the Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk for 18 days from Friday 17 October to Monday 3 November.

With around 450,000 people expected to visit throughout the exhibition, significant delays are expected on roads approaching Bondi and Tamarama beaches including Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr. 

Changed traffic conditions and parking restrictions will be in place.

Motorists should avoid driving through the area where possible or expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time, particularly on weekends.

Road closures and changed traffic conditions:

  • Local roads in Bondi, Bronte and Tamarama will be closed at various times during the event including sections of Notts Ave, Fletcher St, Marks Ln, Kenneth St, Bayview St, Wolaroi Cr, Ashley St, Turner St, Cross St, Birrell St, Darling St, Silva St, Illawong Ave, Carlisle St, Rowland Ave and Wilga St. Access for residents will be maintained.
  • One-way traffic conditions will be in place on roads around the coastal walk between 7.30am Friday 17 October and 6.30am Tuesday 4 November. Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic controllers and exercise caution.

Special event clearways: Strict parking restrictions will be in effect each weekend of the event on Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 October, Saturday 25 and Sunday 26 October and Saturday 1 and Sunday 2 November at the following times and locations:

  • 7am to 2pm: Bondi Rd between Old South Head and opposite Sandridge St at Bondi Beach (northern side)
  • 12pm midday to 7pm: Bondi Rd between Sandridge St at Bondi Beach and Oxford St at Bondi Junction (southern side)
  • 8am to 4pm: Campbell Pde between Queen Elizabeth Drive and Beach Rd at Bondi Beach (Eastern side)

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
Road closures 

Vehicle access for local residents will be maintained for the duration of the road closures. Traffic controllers will be on site to permit access to properties. 

  • 7:30am - 6:30pm Daily (Fri 17 Oct - Mon 3 Nov): Notts Ave, Rowland Ave, Silva St, Wilga St. 
  • 7:30am - 6:30pm Weekends Only (18-19 Oct, 25-26 Oct, 1-2 Nov): Wolaroi Cres 
  • 7:30am Fri 17 Oct - 6:30pm Mon 3 Nov: Carlisle St, Fletcher St, Kenneth St, Marks Ln (one-way southbound traffic only) 
  • 10am Fri 17 Oct - 6:30pm Mon 3 Nov: Ashley St, Bayview St, Illawong Ave 

One-way traffic changes 

The following roads will become one-way only, for the duration of the event: 

7:30am - 6:30pm Daily (Fri 17 Oct – Mon 3 Nov) 

  • Bayview St closed southbound from Hewlett St to Bronte Marine Dr. Northbound traffic only. 

6:30am Fri 17 Oct - 6:30am Tue 4 Nov 

  • Dellview St closed southbound from Fletcher St to Pacific Ave. Northbound traffic only. 
  • Gaerloch Ave closed eastbound and northbound from Dellview St to Alexander St. Southbound traffic only. 
  • Thompson St closed eastbound from Ashley St to Mirimar Ave. Westbound traffic only.  

10am Fri 17 Oct - 6:30pm Mon 3 Nov 

  • Birrell St closed eastbound from Tamarama St to Cross St. 
  • Cross St closed southbound from Birrell St to Turner St. Northbound traffic only. 
  • Darling St closed eastbound from Alfred St to Ashley St. Westbound traffic only. 
  • Mirimar Ave closed southbound from Thompson St to Hewlett St. Northbound traffic only. 
  • Turner St closed eastbound from Cross St to Ashley St. Westbound traffic only.
arrangementElements.title: Road closures & Changed traffic conditions

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle buses will run around the course in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 15,000 participants will walk along a 28km circuit crossing seven iconic bridges in the annual 7 Bridges Walk event.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

  • From 6am to 5.30pm Durham St between Church St and Heath Ave, and Heath Ave from Durham St will be closed. Managed access will be maintained for local residents.

Motorists should slow down, watch for pedestrians and exercise caution.

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on transport. Buses will divert while roads are closed after the show. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Diljit Dosanjh AURA Tour at CommBank Stadium on Sunday. Show starts at 7.30pm and finishes around 10.30pm.

With up to 30,000 people expected, traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Parramatta and car parks are expected to be in high demand.

Allow extra travel time on roads including Parramatta Road, Church Street, Victoria Road, James Ruse Drive and Pennant Hills Road. 

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. 

Drivers are reminded that light rail services are running through Parramatta CBD. Trams can’t stop quickly or easily – so exercise extra caution when driving in the area. 

Road closures 

Roads around the stadium will close from 10.30pm to 11pm approx. to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell Street from Grose Street to George Street 
  • Ross Street from O’Connell Street to Trott Street 
  • Victoria Road from O’Connell Street to Villiers Street 

While closures are in place motorists are encouraged to avoid driving through Parramatta CBD and detour around the closures via Grose Street, Brickfield Street, Victoria Road and Wilde Avenue in both directions.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Ghost in The Rocks festival in Circular Quay and The Rocks precincts from Thursday 30 October until Sunday 2 November. Event runs from 4pm until 11pm on Thursday and Friday; 12pm until 11pm on Saturday & 12pm until 10pm on Sunday.

Events will be held at First Fleet Park, Tallawoladah Lawn, George Street Alfresco Area, and throughout The Rocks precinct including at Jack Mundy, Argyle Street, Playfair Street, Foundation Park, Atherden Street, Kendall Lane alleyways and Cadmans Cottage.

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and to be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL Illawarra Hawks v New Zealand Breakers at WIN Entertainment Centre. Tip-off at 7.30pm, full time around 9.30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Entertainment Centre as fans travel to the match in the already busy evening peak.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Adelaide United at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off at 7pm, full time around 9pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the match in the already busy evening peak. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Double Men: Central Coast Mariners at polytec Stadium. Women v Adelaide United from 2.15pm, men v Wellington Phoenix at 5pm. Finish approx. 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to and from the stadium. Allow extra travel time and use local parking. 

Dane Drive will be closed before the match between the Central Coast Highway and Donnison Street and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Western Sydney Wanderers at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off at 7.45pm, full time around 9.45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Sydney Kings v Tasmania Jackjumpers at Qudos Bank Arena on Sunday. Match starts at 4.30pm and finishes 6.30pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as attendees travel to and from the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Roads may be closed in the precinct, for closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map for more details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
TWICE at Qudos Bank Arena on Saturday 1 and Sunday 2 November. Show starts nightly at 7pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Race day tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Everest Carnival: Golden Eagle Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse on Saturday 1 November. First race at 12.10pm, last race at 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the event.

The right-turn bay into Randwick Racecourse gate 1 on Alison Road (eastbound) will be closed. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special Event Clearways 

Special event clearways will be in place at the following times and locations: 

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and the Grand Drive roundabout (western side) 
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and the roundabout at the entry to Randwick Racecourse (both sides) 
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between Gate Two Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern sides) 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Oasis Live '25 concerts at Accor Stadium on Friday 7 and Saturday 8 November. Gates open from 6pm, concert finishes around 10.45pm each night.

With around 70,000 concert-goers expected at each show, significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct. 

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • PARKING: Do not drive unless you have pre-booked parking. Pre-book online ahead of time to secure a space as parking will be in high demand. A flat rate $35 parking fee applies. 
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Carpool with your group and allow plenty of extra travel time. Significant traffic delays are expected, especially on Friday during the busy evening peak.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event and to accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Special event clearways will be in place at the following locations to facilitate Sydney Trains trackwork replacement bus operations.

  • Chalmers St, western side, between Cleveland St and Devonshire St, and
  • Chalmers St, eastern side, between Cleveland St and Rutland St.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Extra trains will run for event participants. Visit transportnsw.info for more details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 10,000 cyclists will ride from Sydney to Fairy Meadow for the annual MS Gong Ride. The 80 km ride from Tempe Recreation Reserve starts from 6am and the 53km ride will start at Preston Park, Engadine from 8am. Both events finish at Thomas Dalton Park, Fairy Meadow by 3:45pm.

Road and lane closures will be in place along sections of the course.

  • 4am to 9:30am from Tempe to Sutherland: sections of West Botany St, Holbeach Ave and Bestic St. The speed limit will be reduced to 60/km along Rocky Point Rd/Taren Point Rd from Sans Souci to Taren Point.
  • 5am to 10am from Sutherland to Waterfall: Lane closures on the Princes Hwy from Kirrawee to Loftus and the speed limit will be reduced to 60km/h from Kirrawee to Waterfall. Delays are expected travelling southbound on the Princes Hwy during this time. 
  • 5am to 2:30pm in the Royal National Park: McKell Ave, Lady Wakehurst Dr, Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Otford Rd. Access to the Royal National Park is via Farnell Ave only. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h along Lawrence Hargrave Dr from Stanwell Park to Thirroul from 6am to 3pm.
  • 5am to 4.30pm Bulli and Fairy Meadow: sections of Elliotts Rd near the finish area will be closed and the speed limit reduced to 40km/h on sections of Elliotts Rd.

Motorists should exercise caution as cyclists will be sharing some roads along the course. Motorists are reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

Special event clearways will be in place along key sections of the course between 4am and 3pm.

  • Tempe to Kirrawee (from 4am to 10am)
  • Princes Hwy (from 4am to 11am)
  • Stanwell Park to Fairy Meadow (from 5am to 3pm)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.﻿

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Newcastle Jets v Sydney FC at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, full time around 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow while fans are making their way to and from the stadium.

For passenger drop-off, use the allocated 10-minute loading zone in the McDonald Jones Stadium car park. Entry is via the driveway off Turton Road.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Greek Festival will be taking place on Bay St on Sunday 16 Nov. Road closures and parking restrictions will be in effect.

Motorist are advised to allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

From 2am Sunday 16 Nov to 3am Monday 17 Nov the following roads will be closed:

  • Bay St between Queens Rd and The Grand Pde
  • Bay St between Crawford St and Queens Rd (Eastbound lanes)
  • Moate Ave between Bay St and Saywell Ln

Motorists travelling on The Grand Parade will be detoured via local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 2am Sunday 16 Nov until 3am Monday 17 Nov on sections of Moate St and Bay St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Darlinghurst Rd. The event runs from 11am until 8pm.

Road closures from 7am to 11:30pm:

  • Darlinghurst Rd between Roslyn St and Macleay St
  • Macleay St between Darlinghurst Rd and Greenknowe Ave.
  • Sections of Orwell St and Hughes St will be closed.
  • Motorists will be detoured via Greenknowe Ave and Macleay St and via Darlinghurst Rd and Roslyn St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am until 9:30pm on sections of Darlinghurst Rd, Macleay St, Orwell St, Baroda St, Hughes St and other local roads.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operators

Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney - Sydney Streets event on Glebe Point Rd. The event runs from 11am until 8pm.

The following roads will close from 7am to 11.30pm

  • Glebe Point Rd between St Johns Rd and Broadway, and adjoining roads including sections of Cowper St, Derwent Ln, Derby Pl, Francis St, Mitchell St and Norton St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity. Police may restrict vehicle access along closed roads, including residents and businesses.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am until 9:30pm on sections of Glebe Point Rd, Francis St, Derby Pl, Cowper St, Norton St and Mitchell St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • Derwent Ln between Glebe Point Rd and Mitchell St

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures & Special Event Clearways

properties.publicTransport:
For train service disruption information, check trackwork and travel alerts or plan your trip using the Trip Planner.

Light rail services will run every 7.5 minutes from 7am until midnight and every 30 minutes until 1am.

Ferry services run between Stockton and Queens Wharf and will run to their regular timetable.

Visit Newcastle Transport for light rail and ferry information.
properties.otherAdvice:
Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Newcastle Foreshore as attendees travel to and from the festival.

Local roads will be closed including Watt Street, Nobbys Road, Pasha Way and Horseshoe Beach Road.

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people will take part in the annual Sydney Zombie Walk on Saturday 1 November at St Marys Cathedral. Event starts at 10am. Walk starts from 3pm.

The following road closures will be in place to accommodate the event:

From 8am to 5pm: College St between Prince Albert Rd and William St/Park St

From 2.30pm to 5pm:

  • Prince Albert Rd between Macquarie St and St Marys Rd  
  • Macquarie St between Hunter St and St James Rd  
  • St James Rd between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St  
  • King St between Elizabeth St and Phillip St  
  • Phillip St between King St and Hunter St  
  • Elizabeth St southbound from Kings St to Hunter St 

Motorists can detour around the closures via Elizabeth St.

Motorists travelling in the area should allow extra time, watch out for pedestrians and follow directions of Traffic Controllers and NSW Police.

There will be a number of road closures for Jacaranda festival.

Thursday 30 October – Jacaranda Thursday 6am to 3pm

  • Prince Street (from Bacon St to the Clarence River)
  • Pound St (between Wiseman Way and King St)
  • Fitzroy St (between Post Office Lane and Queen St)
  • Victoria St (between Post Office Lane and 76 Victoria St)

Saturday 1 November

  • Vintage Motor Vehicle Display 7am to 2pm, Duke St (between Fitzroy and Victoria St)
  • Jacaranda Float Procession, 3pm to 7pm, Prince Street (Victoria St to Arthur St)

Follow detour signage in place.

arrangementElements.html: Saturday 1 November from 3pm to 7pm, vehicles to be parked up during closure at either the BP truck stop south of Grafton on Big River Way or north at Whiporie Rest Area on Summerland Way.
arrangementElements.title: Operators of oversize and/or overmass

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Eats and Beats street festival will take place once again on Saturday 1 November with road closures in place.

In addition to the Tongarra Rd road closure between Terry St and Russell St, there will also be a local road closure of McGrath Lane. Detours will be in place.

arrangementElements.html:
Vehicles over 14.5m will be detoured via Church St.

Vehicles of 19m to 19.9m will need to detour via Mt Ousley, Picton Rd and the Hume Highway.

Vehicles of 20m long and over will be required to park up and are recommended to delay their journey.

Unless specified otherwise, operators of Class 1,2 & 3 vehicles travelling under a Notice must consult their relevant enforceable network map to confirm a suitable approved alternative route.

Operators of Class 1, 2 & 3 vehicles travelling under a Permit must not travel off the approved route listed in the permit unless an updated permit is obtained from the NHVR.

Please review the Restricted Access Vehicles map to help you plan an alternative route if required.
arrangementElements.title: OSOM Arrangement

properties.diversions:
Motorists will be detoured via Terry St and Russell St or Terry St and Taylor Rd.

Motorists may wish to also consider using Calderwood Rd and Church St.

Heavy vehicles

Heavy Vehicles between 14.5m & 23m long will be detoured via Church St.

All vehicles over 23m long and 3.3m wide should consider using Mt Ousley Road, Picton Road to access the Hume Highway.

All other heavy vehicles will be required to park up for the duration of the event and should consider delaying their journey.

Unless specified otherwise, operators of Class 1,2 & 3 vehicles travelling under a Notice must consult their relevant enforceable network map to confirm a suitable approved alternative route.

Operators of Class 1, 2 & 3 vehicles travelling under a Permit must not travel off the approved route listed in the permit unless an updated permit is obtained from the NHVR

properties.otherAdvice:
The Harden Picnic Races will take place on Saturday 25 October.

A large attendance is expected. A speed reduction will be in place on Burley Griffin Way.

properties.publicTransport: Race day tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Everest Carnival: Spring Champion Stakes Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse on Saturday 25 October. First race at 12.30pm, last race at 6.10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the event.

The right-turn bay into Randwick Racecourse gate 1 on Alison Road (eastbound) will be closed. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special Event Clearways:

Special event clearways will be in place at the following times and locations: 

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and the Grand Drive roundabout (western side) 
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and the roundabout at the entry to Randwick Racecourse (both sides) 
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between Gate Two Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern sides) 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.otherAdvice:
The Red Hot Summer tour music event will be held at Roche Estate.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the area as attendees travel to and from the event, with increased pedestrian activity.

Traffic controllers will be on site to direct motorists.
properties.displayName: SPECIAL EVENT Red Hot Summer Tour

properties.otherAdvice: The fireworks will be held on Inverell Bridge and the Gwydir Highway (Warialda Road) will be closed between Campbell and Brae Streets to traffic and pedestrians between 8pm and 10pm. Campbell St will also be closed between Byron St and Gunson Way between 3pm and 9:30pm.
properties.diversions: Light vehicles detour via Bundarra Rd, Medora St, Cameron St, Macintyre St and Old Bundara Rd to rejoin the Gwydir Hwy. Heavy, oversize and or/overmass vehicles can detour via Runnymeade Dve, Swanbrook Rd, Byron St, Ring St and Jardine Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Central Coast Mariners FC at Leichhardt Oval on Saturday. Kick-off 7.35pm, full time at 9.30pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James St, Perry St, Balmain Rd, Mary St and Glover St as attendees travel to and from the match.

A section of Mary Street may close before the game and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area. Traffic will be detoured via Chapel Street while the closure is in place.   

Motorists requiring access to other venues in the park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
James Blunt at Qudos Bank Arena on Saturday. Show starts at 7.15pm and finishes around 10pm.

Sydney Olympic Park will be busy with music fans also attend an event at nearby Sydney Showgrounds.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Route 900 buses will be diverting while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Parramatta Lanes is taking place in the Parramatta CBD from Wednesday 22 to Saturday 25 October. Being held at over 20+ sites including gardens, rooftop carparks and lanes, the event starts daily at 5pm. The event will finish at 10pm on Wednesday and Thursday, and at 10.30pm on Friday and Saturday.

Road closures will be in place from Monday 20 to Monday 27 October on sections of Macquarie St, Phillip St and George St to safely facilitate the event. Parking restrictions will also be in place on George St, Macquarie St and Phillip St so check signs carefully.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the area and on detour routes as attendees travel to and from the event. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd, and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

arrangementElements.html:
PARRAMATTA CBD

WEDNESDAY 23, THURSDAY 24, FRIDAY 25 & SATURDAY 26 OCTOBER

FROM 3PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • Macquarie Street between Marsden Street and Horwood Place (eastbound) 

FROM 6PM TO 10.30PM

  • Phillip Street between Marsden Street and Horwood Place (both directions)

  • George Street between Marsden Street and Horwood Place (both directions) 

FROM 1PM SATURDAY 26 TO 5AM SUNDAY 27 OCTOBER

  • George Street between Marsden Street and Horwood Place (both directions)

roads.mainStreet: O'Connell Street, Phillip Street, Macquarie St and George Street

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Extra light rail services will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip
properties.otherAdvice:
One Day International Cricket: Australia v India at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Start of play at 2.30pm and end of play ay 10pm

With up to 40,000 cricket fans expected, ticketholders are urged to catch public transport and leave the car at home to avoid traffic delays and the high demand for parking. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group and allow extra travel time as traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 10.30am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.  
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue, however access to EP2 Kippax car park will be maintained via Moore Park Road and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Road.
  • Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to midnight on sections of Albion St, Fitzroy St. and Moore Park Rd, and from 6am to midnight on Cleveland St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to midnight on sections of Albion Street and Moore Park Road, and from 6am to midnight on Cleveland Street and Fitzroy St.  

From 6am to 12am 

  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (southern side) 
  • Cleveland Street between Abercrombie Street and South Dowling Street (northern side) 
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side) 

From 3pm to 12am  

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides) 
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)  
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Green Road (northern side)

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Oktoberfest in the Garden 2025 at The Domain on Saturday, from 1pm to 9pm.

With thousands of attendees expected, traffic will be heavier than usual in the CBD as crowds travel to and from the event.

If you are catching rideshare or taxis, use the dedicated drop-off location on Hospital Road at Art Gallery Road. For pick-ups after the event head towards Elizabeth Street or Sir John Young Crescent.  

Roads within and around The Domain will close for crowd safety before, during and after the event. Motorists should avoid driving through the area or expect delays and detours.

ROAD CLOSURES

The following roads will be closed from 7pm 

  • Art Gallery Road from Hospital Road to Mrs Macquarie Road 

The following roads will be closed from 8pm to 10pm 

  • St Mary’s Rd from Prince Albert Rd to Sir John Young Cr 
  • Prince Albert Rd from Macquarie St to Art Gallery Rd 
  • Hospital Rd from Art Gallery Rd to Shakespeare Pl 
  • Macquarie St from Hunter St to Prince Albert Rd 
  • St James Rd from Elizabeth St to Macquarie St 
  • College St from Park St to Prince Albert Rd 
  • Cathedral St at St Marys Rd

roads.mainStreet: Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, College St, Art Gallery Rd

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ridin' Hearts music festival at Sydney Showground on Saturday. Event starts at 1pm and finishes 10.50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road. 

Roads may be closed in the Sydney Olympic Park precinct. Heavy traffic is expected, follow directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police.

For road closure details and locations, see visit the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Route 437, 440 and 445 bus services will be diverting while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Norton Street Italian Festa is on from 10am to 5pm. 

Traffic may be heavy in the area and on approach to Leichhardt, including on Parramatta Rd and the City West Link. Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and expect delays.

  • Norton St is closed between Marion St and William St until 9pm. Other local roads around Norton St are also now closed from 6am.
  • Special event clearways are in effect on sections of Norton Street and William St until 9pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Route 526 and 533 buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 1,500 people are expected to participate in the annual Billbergia Bennelong Bridge Run from 6.50am to 10am.

Changed traffic conditions including road closures will be in place to safely facilitate the event.

Motorists travelling around Rhodes, Wentworth Point and Olympic Park should allow additional travel time, follow diversions and directions of traffic controllers and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Road closures:

  • 4am to 11am: sections of Australia Ave, Kevin Coombs Ave, Marjorie Jackson Parkway and Holker Busway
  • 5am to 10am: sections of Hill Rd, Footbridge Blvd, Wentworth Pl, Bennelong Bridge, Waterways St, Wentworth St, Shoreline Dr, Annie Leggett Promenade.

Lane closures will also be in place on sections of Jamieson St and Holker St from 5am to 10am, along with stop/slow traffic conditions at the intersection of Hill Rd and Footbridge Boulevarde, and Jamieson St between Holker St and the shared pathway.

  • Holker Busway from Kevin Coombs Avenue to Hill Road.

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures & Special Event Clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
The Citrus Sculptures event is on once again, with 80,000 expected to attend.

Banna Avenue will be closed between Crossing Street and Jondaryan Avenue for the Griffith Citrus Sculptures event, including set up and pack down.

Detours will be in place.
properties.diversions:
Light vehicles will be detoured via Yambil St.

Heavy vehicles will be detoured via Bridge St and Crossing St.

On the 12 and 26 Oct between 6am and 2.30pm all vehicles will detoured via Bridge St and Crossing St.

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle buses will run around the course in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 15,000 participants will walk along a 28km circuit crossing seven iconic bridges in the annual 7 Bridges Walk event.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

From 7:30am to 4pm 1 lane eastbound closed on River Rd between Lane Cove Country Club driveway (Stevenson St) and Greenwich Hospital Pedestrian Crossing (St Vincents Rd).

Motorists should slow down, watch for pedestrians and exercise caution.

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle buses will run around the course in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 15,000 participants will walk along a 28km circuit crossing seven iconic bridges in the annual 7 Bridges Walk event.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

From 5am to 4pm the following roads within Callan Park will be closed:

  • Central Ave between Military Dr and North Crescent/Waterfront Dr
  • Military Dr between Wharf Rd and Central Ave 
  • North Crescent from Park Dr 
  • Waterfront Dr between Military Dr and Central Avenue

Motorists should slow down, watch for pedestrians and exercise caution.
